frame.name: Manipulation
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an <fen>Entity</fen> by an <fen>Agent</fen>. Generally, this implies that the <fen>Entity</fen> is not deeply or permanently physically affected, nor is it overall moved from one place to another.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Ian</fex> <t>squeezed</t> <fex name="Entity">Mara's hand</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex>
A number of lexemes listed in this frame also occur in the Cause_motion frame (for example, <ment>push, yank</ment>). Only the non-motion uses of these words belong in this frame, e.g., combinations such as <ment>push at, push on, yank at</ment>. </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects. <fen>Agent</fen> is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs:
<ex><fex name="Agent">A robot arm</fex> <t>grasps</t> the box on the conveyor belt and seals it.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs:
<ex><t>Squeeze</t> <fex name="Entity">the ball</fex> as many times as you can.</ex> <ex>Pat <t>squeezed</t> <fex name="Entity">Jo's hand</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locus
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s manipulation of an <fen>Entity</fen> may be further specified as being localized to some part of the <fen>Entity</fen>, a <fen>Locus</fen>. The <fen>Locus</fen> is usually expressed as a PP Complement. <ex>Pat <t>squeezed</t> Jo <fex name="Locus">by the hand</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Bodypart_of_agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body being used to manipulate the <fen>Entity</fen> may also be expressed. While the default is for an <fen>Agent</fen> to use his/her hands, other body parts may be specified. This frame element usually occurs as a PP-complement. <ex>Kim <t>grasped</t> the needle <fex name="Bodypart_of_agent">between finger and thumb</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of the manipulation.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>When the manipulation takes place <ex>I <t>seized</t> the letter <fex name="Time">before he did</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s purpose in performing the manipulation. <ex>The President <t>grabbed</t> <t>hold</t> of the handle of the helicopter <fex name="Purp">to avoid being blown away</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that interacts with the <fen>Entity</fen> to accomplish the action indicated by the target.
<ex>Smithers <t>nudged</t> the insect <fex name="Instrument">with a paper towel</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action by the <fen>Agent</fen> to accomplish the desired manipulation.
<ex>Martin <t>clutched</t> it <fex name="Means">by pulling a rope attached to a pully which tightened the belt to the PVC</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The spatial setting in which the manipulation takes place.
<ex><fex name="Place">In the hallway</fex> he managed to <t>grab</t>the monarch by the ankles</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a depictive phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Bodypart_of_agent</fen> that holds throughout the action.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs leading to the manipulation.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: clasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grasp tightly with one's hand.

lexUnit.name: claw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: try desperately to move something with the hands.

lexUnit.name: clutch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: grasp and hold tightly

lexUnit.name: finger.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: touch or feel with the fingers.

lexUnit.name: grab.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: seize suddenly and roughly.

lexUnit.name: grasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: seize and hold firmly.

lexUnit.name: grip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take and keep a firm hold of; grasp tightly.

lexUnit.name: knead.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: work (something) with the hands

lexUnit.name: massage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rub (muscles or joints) with the hands so as to relieve tension or pain.

lexUnit.name: nip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pinch, squeeze, or bite sharp

lexUnit.name: nudge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to poke or prod

lexUnit.name: paw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel or scrape with a paw or hoof.

lexUnit.name: pinch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grip (the flesh) tightly and sharply between finger and thumb.

lexUnit.name: pull.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to exert force on something towards oneself

lexUnit.name: push.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: exert force on something away from oneself

lexUnit.name: seize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take hold of suddenly and forcibly.

lexUnit.name: squeeze.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: firmly press from opposite or all sides, typically with the fingers.

lexUnit.name: tug.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pull on something hard and suddenly

lexUnit.name: tweak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: twist or pull with a small but sharp movement.

lexUnit.name: wring.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: squeeze (someone's hand) tightly.

lexUnit.name: yank.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to tug on something causing it to move

lexUnit.name: fumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: use the hands clumsily while doing or handling something

lexUnit.name: grope.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel or fondle (someone) for sexual pleasure, especially against their will.

lexUnit.name: stroke.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: move one's hand with gentle pressure over (a surface).

lexUnit.name: rub.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: apply firm pressure against the surface of, using a repeated back and forth motion

lexUnit.name: grab hold.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grasp

lexUnit.name: pull.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of pulling something.

lexUnit.name: lick.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pass the tongue over (something), typically in order to taste, moisten, or clean it.

lexUnit.name: touch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring one's hand or another part of one's body into contact with.

lexUnit.name: kiss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: touch or caress with the lips as a sign of love, affection, or greeting.

lexUnit.name: caress.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: touch or stroke gently or lovingly.

lexUnit.name: caress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a gentle or loving touch.

lexUnit.name: stroke.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move one's hand with gentle pressure over (a surface).

lexUnit.name: diddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to manipulate with the finger, usually irregularly

lexUnit.name: hold.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to grasp, especially with one's hands or arms

lexUnit.name: tickle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: touch lightly, often causing uncontrollable laughter and other reactions

lexUnit.name: handle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: hold (esp. said of merchandise).

lexUnit.name: kiss.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Touch or caress with the lips as a sign of love, care, or greeting

lexUnit.name: poke.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: touch somewhat forcefully with the end of a relatively long, thin object.
